quote: That puts Ellis as the new titleholder. That short and sweet peck with Natalie put him over the top.
summary: The article discusses the Season 29 premiere of 'The Bachelor,' where the show’s newest lead, Grant Ellis, begins his journey to find love among 25 contestants. Known for his past as a pro basketball player and day trader, Ellis is noted for kissing nearly one-third of the women on the first night, setting a new record compared to past seasons. Notable interactions include a bonding moment over the movie 'The Notebook' with contestant Allyshia, who initially declared she doesn't kiss on the first date. Ellis dispensed his first impression rose to Alexe, marking her for a special one-on-one date. The premiere wraps up with anticipation for future episodes, highlighting Ellis's eagerness to develop genuine connections based on romance and adventure.
title: Grant Ellis goes big for his night 1 kiss count on the ‘Bachelor.’ Here’s how that compares to past seasons.

facts: Selena Gomez is of Mexican descent through her father's side.
Born in Texas, she has family history involving immigration from Mexico.
She has 422 million Instagram followers.
Produced the 2019 Netflix docuseries on families facing deportation.
UNICEF ambassador advocating for children since 2009.
figures.name: Selena Gomez

facts: Responsible for deportation policies that were criticized by Selena Gomez.
organizations.name: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement

facts: Reported that nearly 52% of arrests by ICE were 'criminal arrests'.
organizations.name: NBC News

quote: "All my people are getting attacked. The children … I don’t know what to do."
summary: Selena Gomez posted an emotional video on her Instagram Story reacting to President Trump's immigration policies, particularly the deportations carried out by the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. The video, in which Gomez, who is of Mexican descent, teared up over the treatment of immigrants, was quickly deleted but sparked significant political backlash. Prominent figures supporting the deportation policies, like Tom Homan and Sam Parker, criticized Gomez sharply, with Parker even suggesting deportation for Gomez due to her ancestry. Despite removing the video, Gomez continued to express empathy and discuss her family's history of immigration to the U.S., highlighting her fears regarding the current state of immigration debates. The criticisms were discussed on platforms like Sean Hannity's show, further entrenching the video into political discourse.
title: Selena Gomez posts an emotional reaction to Trump's deportations. The criticism was swift.
